conclusion: To solve the problem, I will analyze the velocity-time graph to determine the acceleration phases of particles A and B. I will then calculate the ratio of their accelerations using the slope of the acceleration phases.

conclusion: Calculate the acceleration for particle A during its acceleration phase (t0 to 2t0). The slope of the velocity-time graph during this phase represents the acceleration. The slope is 2v0 / t0.

conclusion: Calculate the acceleration for particle B during its acceleration phase (t0 to 2t0). The slope of the velocity-time graph during this phase represents the acceleration. The slope is also 2v0 / t0.

conclusion: Determine the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B. Since both particles have the same acceleration during their acceleration phases, the ratio is 1:1.

premise: In a v-t graph, the slope represents acceleration. From the graph, it can be seen that the ratio of the accelerations of A and B during their acceleration phases is equal to the ratio of their slopes, which is 2:1 for the red line.
conclusion: Therefore, the ratio of the accelerations of A and B is 2:1.
